revised_title: The Study of Reflex Inhibition and Excitation in Skeletal Muscles
tldr: The author investigates the relationship between reflex inhibition and reflex excitation in skeletal muscles using the vasto-crureus muscle as a case study. They found that the intensity of the stimuli applied to the afferent nerves determines whether the muscle experiences relaxation or contraction. The results indicate that the antagonism between reflexes is reversible and can be graded in intensity, providing insight into the complex interactions between opposing neural signals.
